crafts http //www ravelry com/designers/sherri-bush contact me at sherricrochets@gmail com hail to the chief pattern difficulty medium i assume you already know how to crochet how to crochet in the round how to read a pattern and how to sew pieces together supplies  size g hook will make approx 9 - 10 doll or around the size of a barbie doll  yarn i used red heart super saver small amounts of each of these colors  black for shoes and facial features  dark blue for his pants  off white for his shirt  dark red for his tie  light brown for his skin  dark brown for his hair and facial features or feel free to use any colors you like gauge is unimportant for this project terms single_crochet = single_crochet half_double_crochet = half-double_crochet double_crochet = double_crochet slip_stitch = slip_stitch increase = increase two single_crochet in same stitch decrease = single_crochet two stitches together work even = single_crochet in each single_crochet around ch1 t = chain 1 turn blo = back loops only flo = front loops only note this doll is worked in the round i join rounds and i single_crochet in the same space as joining so i m assuming that at the end of each round you are slip stitching to the first stitch of that round and that you chain 1 to start the next round you can work in spirals if that s easier for you just remember to mark your rounds you want your stitches tight and close together so the stuffing doesn t show through later on to start each piece you can chain 2 and work your 6 stitches into the 2nd stitch from the hook or you can use the magic adjustable loop highly recommended found here http //www crochetme com/sc2tog_jan_0405/reads_round html page 2 of 7 copyright sherri bush ~ sherri crochets & crafts http //www ravelry
